20.title:  Shoe
20.author: MacNelly.
20.series: Oct. 21, 1977) "A Desk, a Telephone, a Typewriter"*
notes: Summary: Shoe thinks he's ready to start his newspaper, but Cosmo says he also needs a libel lawyer. Shoe's desk is a garbage can.

21.title:  Shoe
21.author: MacNelly
21.appears_in: reproduced on p. 121 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Cosmo is caddying for Shoe, and recommends an iron for a par 8 hole.

22.title:  Shoe
22.author: MacNelly
22.series: Aug. 29, 1981) "They Meant to Say It's a Game of Hours"*
22.appears_in: reproduced on p. 121 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Bumpkins is caddying for the Professor, who remarks that golf is a game of inches.

23.title:  Shoe
23.author: MacNelly.
23.series: Apr. 6, 1983) "I Hate To See Small Animals Suffer"*
notes: Summary: The Professor takes another helping because Roz was just going to feed it to the dog.

24.title:  Shoe
24.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Shoe tells the Professor to make his story on the Pentagon budget easier to understand.

25.title:  Shoe
25.author: MacNelly.
25.series: Aug. 20, 1983) "Time Left to Lie Down in the ol' Hammock"*
notes: Summary: The new riding mower looked like a good thing, until it destroyed the hammock.

26.title:  Shoe
26.author: MacNelly.
26.series: Dec. 5, 1983) "It Would Give You a Nice Change of Pace from Whatever it is you do Around Here"*
notes: Summary: Shoe doesn't see why Roz, the cook at the diner, doesn't cook for herself at home.

27.title:  Shoe
27.author: MacNelly
27.series: 1984) "A Caddy Might Be Able to Find the Ball, but a Golf Cart Will Never Laugh At You"*
27.appears_in: reproduced on p. 120 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).

28.title:  Shoe
28.author: MacNelly.
28.series: Apr. 14, 1984) "Tobacco Juice Won't Soak Into It"*
notes: Summary: Artificial turf is deemed incompatible with baseball.

29.title:  Shoe
29.author: MacNelly.
29.series: July 17, 1985) "I Happen to Have a Very Bad Allergy"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo's allergy to perspiration prevents him from mowing his lawn.

30.title:  Shoe
30.author: MacNelly.
30.series: July 21, 1984) "Allergic to Various Grasses and Pollens and Work in All its Hideous Forms"*
notes: SUMMARY: Skyler has to mow the lawn because of Cosmo's wheezing.

31.title:  Shoe
31.author: MacNelly.
31.series: May 20, 1985) "Low Slung in the Seat, and Needing a Swift Kick-Start"*
notes: Summary: Shoe compares the Perfesser to his old Harley Davidson.

32.title:  Shoe
32.author: MacNelly.
32.series: July 18, 1985) "But for a Story on Pest Control?"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo objects to an attention-grabbing headline: Thousands Dead!

33.title:  Shoe
33.author: MacNelly.
33.series: Sept. 14, 1985) "Thanks for Your Snow Shovel, Irv"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo returns Irv's snow shovel with an apology for how long it took, then asks to borrow Irv's lawn mower.

34.title:  Shoe
34.author: MacNelly.
34.series: Sept. 24, 1985) "I Guess You Lawn Care Pros have a Special Name for This Special Turf"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo's getting a new, lush, natural-looking lawn, and its special name is 'astro'.

35.title:  Shoe
35.author: by Jeff MacNelly.
notes: Summary: The mob guy in the wheelchair is a victim of the leading cause of heart disease.

36.title:  Shoe
36.author: by Jeff MacNelly.
36.series: Nov. 26, 1985) "How Much Are We Selling Our Old Typewriters For?"*
notes: Summary: When Shoe hears it's the Pentagon looking for typewriters, he ups the price to $45,000 each.

37.title:  Shoe
37.author: MacNelly.
37.series: Nov. 30, 1985) "Now I Got Holes from Cigarette Butts, a Whole Acre to Vacuum, a Four-Wheel Drive Rug Shampoo Tractor with a Carpet Deodorizer Spreader"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo had the 'Marquis d'Sod Lawn Service' install astroturf, and there's no more weeds, seeds, fertilizing or watering.

38.title:  Shoe
38.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Mr. Loon hears the results of his brain scan.

39.title:  Shoe
39.author: MacNelly.
39.series: Jan. 22, 1986) "He Probably Would Have Made a Better Lawyer"*
notes: Summary: Skyler confronts a difficult passage, supposedly from Shakespeare: "Any man who sayeth doth not stand upon need, Needeth not lest he stand in want of need."

40.title:  Shoe
40.author: MacNelly.
40.series: Apr. 15, 1986) "His Cooking is Definitely Related to Illness"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo tries to deduct the cost of groceries on his income tax return.

41.title:  Shoe
41.author: by Jeff MacNelly.
41.series: Apr. 23, 1986) "That's Where the Tobacco Juice Killed it Off"*
notes: Summary: Skyler and Cosmo are at the ballpark, wondering why the mound and basepaths have no grass.

42.title:  Shoe
42.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Cosmo questions running the headline with no story, then sees that the reader is referred to the New York Times.

43.title:  Shoe
43.author: MacNelly.
43.series: July 20, 1986) "Sunbathe on a Vertically-Striped Beach Towel Next to a Beached Sea Elephant"*
notes: Summary: The Perfesser's advice column addresses ways to look svelte on the beach.
Year indistinct on clipped strip; 1986 or 1988.

44.title:  Shoe
44.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Shoe observes a dogleg to the left, but the fairway looks straight to the Professor.

notes: Summary: Cosmo has a swamp glider on the course.

notes: Summary: Shoe whiffs a shot.

47.series: Aug. 4, 1986) "Planning a Short Day, I See"*
notes: Summary: Shoe can tell that the Professor is planning to sneak out for golf, because the clubs don't quite fit in the briefcase.

48.series: Sept. 9, 1986) "Golf Would Be a Whole Lot More Enjoyable if you had Teammates to Blame the Bad Shots On"
notes: Summary: Skyler is talking, and Cosmo's ball is up in a tree.

50.series: Sept. 23, 1986) "Golf Keeps Me on a Even Keel"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo goes golfing when he's in a really good mood, and it evens out.

51.author: MacNelly.
notes: Summary: Skyler thinks football is ungentlemanly.

notes: Summary: The Cowboys have eight turnovers, but the Professor has had twelve already.

notes: Summary: Cosmo puts Tabasco on his food before tasting it.

notes: Summary: Skyler learns that Ben Franklin was an inventor.

55.series: Oct. 26, 1987) "A Doberman Chained to the Spare"*
notes: Summary: He doesn't have a car alarm, he has a truck alarm.

57.series: June 7, 1988) "Wearing Running Shoes FROM Work I'd Understand"*

58.series: June 28, 1988) "Maybe They Help Them Find the Fire Hydrants"*

59.series: July 13, 1988) "I'm Approaching Old Age at the Speed of Light"*
notes: Summary: Cosmo says he only looks like a bucket of tapioca.

notes: (Golf Tips from the Perfesser)

61.title:  Shoe
61.author: by Jeff MacNelly.
61.series: Nov. 24, 1988) "We Oughta Go Back to Duels"*
notes: Summary: Shoe thinks the solution to the problem of too many lawsuits is for lawyers to fight duels. Shoe is sitting at his desk, which is a garbage can.

62.title:  Shoe
62.author: MacNelly.
62.series: Nov. 28, 1988) "Or You Can Hire a Lawyer"*

notes: Summary: The Professor uses a flattened ball for water holes.

65.author: MacNelly.

notes: Summary: Will the playoff be sudden death, or slow death?

84.series: Nov. 18, 1992) "Fortunately, I Can Still Outrun It"*
notes: Summary: The Professor's paperwork has caught up to him, so he leaves with his golf bag.

notes: Summary: Roz has a new book out, a cookbook without pictures.

86.title:  Shoe

notes: Summary: The Senator caved in and voted his conscience.
